item.title: Difference between .bashrc and .bash_profile
item.description: this cute little article dispels any confusion u have regarding the bashrc and bash_profile scripts!

item.title: Why the TurboGrafx-16 Failed
item.description: The TurboGrafx-16 should have been a hit game system when it was released in the USA - but it never came close to the success of the PC Engine in Japan. Here's what NEC/Hudson did wrong.

item.title: Introducing Microsoft Silverlight - Cross platform, Cross browser plug-in
item.description: Redmond's next-generation, cross-platform, cross-browser web client runtime. This MS developers's blog gives top 10 reasons why you should use it, including a tease of a big announcement at MIX. Enjoy!!!

item.title: Why you should be using HTML 4.01 instead of XHTML
item.description: If you're a web developer, you've probably heard about XHTML, the markup language developed in 1999 to implement HTML as an XML format. Most people who use and promote XHTML do so because they think it's the newest and hottest thing, and they may have heard of some (usually false) benefits here and there. But there is a lot more to it than ...

item.title: THIS. IS. MUSHROOM KINGDOM!!
item.description: Mario ain't havin none of it.

item.title: New US Passport Design is, um, Incredible?
item.description: The new U.S. e-passport will incorporate updated security features and a new design. This design will reflect the varied landscapes of our country and each page will include a quote reflecting the hope and success that is the United States of America. They sure crammed in as much imagery as they could. Pretty incredible.

item.title: Jack Thompson Blames VaTech Shooting on video games
item.description: Jack Thompson Blames VaTech Shooting on video games

item.title: Attention all musicians. Give your music away for free!
item.description: It's no secret that the record industry is in trouble. They have moved from selling music as their main source of income to creating revenue through lawsuits against their customers. Here are a few concepts every musician today should understand in order to thrive in the new music economy.

item.title: Adult Swim's Low Bandwith Site
item.description: Possibly the coolest thing I've ever seen!

item.title: Geek Culture [PICS]
item.description: These are the greatest monitor setups I have ever seen.

item.title: Rove, others were warned to save e-mails
item.description: Karl Rove and other White House employees were cautioned in employee manuals, memos and briefings to carefully save any e-mails that might discuss official matters even if those messages came from private e-mail accounts, the White House disclosed Friday.

item.title: Top 10 Strangest Custom Gaming Systems
item.description: Wow. Just wow. These people have to much time on there hands.

item.title: The Atheist's Wager
item.description: One atheist's clever answer to Pascal's Wager.

item.title: A Do-It-Yourself Quantum Eraser
item.description: Using readily available equipment, you can carry out a home experiment that illustrates one of the weirdest effects in quantum mechanics

item.title: Why Did We Allow Bush Retroactive Immunity For War Crimes?
item.description: Apparently this Bill passed. I don't get it.

item.title: Mac Fans Ballistic over Leopard Delay; "...for a #^@$%#ing cell phone?"
item.description: Mac users, whether casual or fanatic, aren't taking the bad news sitting down. When Apple Inc. announced Thursday that it will delay the release of Mac OS X 10.5 "Leopard" by four months, they jumped on their soapboxes -- the Internet's forums and news story comments and blogs -- to rant and sometimes even rage at the Cupertino machine

item.title: As Religious Strife Grows, Europe's Atheists Seize Pulpit
item.description: Indifference to faith has left Europe's churches mostly empty. But debate over religion is more intense than its been in many decades. Religion is re-emerging as an issue because of Europe's growing and restive Muslim populations and a fear that faith is reasserting itself in politics. That is adding up to momentum for a combative brand of atheism.

item.title: This is How We Catch You Downloading
item.description: All over Europe thousands of people are being threatened with court action for allegedly sharing games like Dream Pinball 3D on P2P networks. Now, documents obtained by TorrentFreak show details of the anti-piracy company's techniques for identifying alleged file-sharers on the internet...

item.title: The secrets of a super-slim wallet
item.description: Get rid of that George Costanza wallet, check out these secrets of a super-slim wallet.

item.title: Designing With Grid-Based Approach
item.description: We’ve read through over 50 articles and selected some of the most important and interesting facts web-developers should know about the grid-based approach. Besides, we’ve listed the most useful references, tutorials and tools we found - with precise descriptions of what the articles are about.

item.title: Zelda DS Will Have 1-On-1 Voice Chat!
item.description: Phantom Hourglass is due out this holiday season, and comes with a battle mode that has one player scrambling for pieces of the Triforce while being attacked by their opponent. And now, Famitsu confirms that while you're kick your opponent's ass over WiFi, you'll be able to scream insults at him as well.

item.title: 5 Modifications You Shouldn't Do to Your Car
item.description: There are tons of modifications you can do to your car. Whether it be lightweight body parts, turbo kits, free flowing exhaust kits; they all aid to performance. However, if you own or want to own a more performance oriented car, here are 5 modifications that you shouldn’t do to your car.

item.title: GNU Screen - the ASCII window manager
item.description: GNU Screen or screen in short is something I discovered late in my UNIXromance. Now that I have got hooked to it there is no going back. One ofthe first packages I install on any linux distro is this marvellouscreation. Let us take a dekko at this and see what makes it soversatile.

item.title: Mac OS X Theme Change in Newest Leopard Build
item.description: An earlier article reported that Leopard Build 9A410 had been seeded to developers.The most obvious visual change in the newest build is a shift away from "Brushed Metal" which Apple uses in many applications such as Safari and Finder. Screenshots of the new theme show a simpler look.

item.title: Nintendo Pokes Fun at Microsoft and Zelda II in Super Paper Mario! (Pics)
item.description: Spoiler warning! Everything goes crazy when Mario's first boss goes haywire and starts ranting random things!

item.title: Lingua, a super-lightweight AJAX blogging engine
item.description: Lingua is designed to be a very lightweight, extremely flexible blogging engine, designed with aesthetics very high on the priorities list. There isn't a full release yet but the subversion is pretty stable, and already has people using and theming it. Suggestions are welcome at the community, in the "Brainstorm" forum!

item.title: Conan O'Brien's Harvard Commencement Speech
item.description: quite possibly the best commencement speech ever delivered.

item.title: Chopsticks + Fork= The Chork
item.description: The convenience of a fork and the style of chopsticks. Pretty ingenious!

item.title: UPDATE: Police officer beats Sikh Iraq War veteran, POLICE: "No Comment"
item.description: I called the Joilet Police today about the story where a Police officer beat a Sikh-American man so badly he was put in the hospital for 5 days. They had little to say, so I wrote that up in my blog and included contact information for the City of Joilet so that other Diggers could make their own investigation. I will be calling SALDEF later.

item.title: Mac OS X Leopard Delayed to meet iPhone Targets
item.description: Apple shifted developers from leopard to the iPhone team. The result: Leopard delayed to October, and the iPhone in late June.

item.title: Aqua Teen Hunger Force WILL be shown in Boston!!
item.description: Despite Mayor Thomas M. Menino’s plea to local theaters not to screen it “out of respect to the people of Boston.”

item.title: Bubba: The best Linux appliance ever
item.description: Bubba is both heavier and smaller than I expected, weighing roughly 3.5 pounds and yet scarcely larger than a typical 3.5-inch IDE drive. Four models are available, differing in the size of their hard drive from 80 to 750GB. The Bubba I tested had a 320GB drive. The device comes with a short Category 5 cable, power supply, and power cord.

item.title: Apple TV and HD quality: It's not the hardware
item.description: We quickly realized that the Apple TV wasn't going to be a HD powerhouse and our tests have indicated as much -- we have also discovered that the problem is not the hardware. We opened up our Apple TV and added a few codecs and we were very surprised at the results...

item.title: Why there aren't viruses for Macs — it's not because of low market share.
item.description: Apple haters love to claim that there are no viruses for Macs because there are so few compared to Windows machines. Virus creators are in the business because of ego. And what would be a bigger ego boost than being the first to create a widespread OS X virus?

item.title: Google Faces Brain Drain As Anniversaries Hit
item.description: Less than three years after going public, Google is confronting one of the more confounding consequences of its phenomenal success: a potential brain drain if its earliest -- and richest -- employees quit after earning the right to cash in the last of the stock options that made them millionaires.

item.title: Mother Goes Ballistic at Her Son for Becoming an Atheist (Video)
item.description: "Then you're going to get absolutely nothing, nothing for Christmas!"

item.title: Embryo ethics: Why Stem Cells Aren't People
item.description: As the debate over stem cell research resumes in Washington this week, the moral principle on which the White House bases its position remains largely unexamined. We take a look at the arguments for and against.

item.title: Video: Tom Delay compares himself to the 6 million jews of the Holocaust
item.description: "it doesn't matter if it's 6 million jews or one man getting investigated, it's the exact same thing. " no Tom, no it isn't. shame on you.

item.title: Automate Your BitTorrent TV Downloads on OS X
item.description: Downloading your favorite TV show is much easier than it was a few years ago with the help of torrent indexing sites and great software. With the arrival of the open source TVShows application, the whole thing just got even easier.

item.title: Spiderman 3 star Kristen Dunst likes Cannabis
item.description: Carl Sagan, the astronomer, was the biggest pot smoker in the world and he was a genius. I've never been a major smoker, but I think America's view on weed is ridiculous. I mean - are you kidding me? If everyone smoked weed, the world would be a better place.
